title: MS AccessEnviron()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MS AccessEnviron()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Return a string that contains the value of an operating system environment 
variable:
SELECT Environ(1);
Definition and Usage
The Environ() function returns a string that contains the value of an operating system environment variable.
Syntax
Environ(
number
)
OR:
Environ(
string
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
number
The numeric order of the environment 
    string in the environment-string table
string
The name of an environment variable
Technical Details
Works in:
From Access 2000

❯
★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers MS AccessEnviron()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MS AccessEnviron()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MS AccessEnviron()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
